etymology.interpretation: The character 一(yī, 'one') directly represents the concept of 'one' through a single horizontal stroke, visually embodying the idea of singularity and unity.

examples.chinese: 我有一只猫(我有一隻貓)。
他只需要一把伞(他只需要一把傘)，就能出门(就能出門)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhǐ xūyào yī bǎ sǎn, jiù néng chūmén.
examples.english: He only needs one umbrella to go out.

examples.chinese: 桌上只有一支笔(桌上只有一支筆)。
examples.pinyin: Zhuō shàng zhǐ yǒu yī zhī bǐ.
examples.english: There is only one pen on the table.
